summary: Brenda L Welburn is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on multiple payroll and certification reports. These documents list her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings for various months in 1978, including May, October, and November. The documents suggest she was a staff member during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Brenda L Welburn's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
